title.narrative: Legal Resources Foundation 2016-2020: Access to Justice Programme
Legal Resources Foundation 2016-2020: Access tó Justice Programme

description.narrative:
Legal Resources Foundation (LRF) bistår med juridisk rådgivning och assistans för missgynnade och marginaliserade samhällsgrupper i såväl urbana som rurala områden i hela Zimbabwe. Ambassaden ska tillhandahålla LRF med kärnstöd under år 2016 till 2019 i syfte att förbättra tillgången till rättssystemet i Zimbabwe. Detta ska ske utifrån följande delmål:
• Stärka zimbabwiers kapacitet att hävda sina mänskliga och lagenliga rättigheter med självförtroende och tillförlit till rättsystemet. • Förbättra tillgången till rättssystemet för utsatta, bidra till att lagen samt de utökade konstitutionella och mänskliga rättigheterna efterföljs. • Ett effektivt och ansvarstagande rättssystem i Zimbabwe. • Att möjliggörande ett klimat där demokratiska rättigheter krävs av en medveten befolkning som kräver att konstitutionella och mänskliga rättigheter ska upprätthållas och skyddas. • Ökad förståelse samt medvetenhet kring juridiska frågor. • En organisation som är ekonomiskt varaktig, har motiverad personal och som arbetar effektivt och ändamålsenligt.
Den totala budgeten för insatsen är 2,390,000 USD, Sverige bidrar med totalt 15 000 000 SEK (1 760 000 USD) under perioden 2016-2019, i enlighet med ovan fördelning.

The Legal Resources Foundation (LRF) provides legal advice and assistance to disadvantaged and marginalized communities in both urban and rural areas throughout Zimbabwe. The embassy will provide LRF with core support from 2016 to 2019 in order to improve access to the legal system in Zimbabwe. This should be done on the basis of the following sub-goals:
• Strengthen Zimbabweans' capacity to assert their human and legal rights with confidence and trust in the justice system. • Improve access to the legal system for the vulnerable, contribute to compliance with the law and the expanded constitutional and human rights. • An efficient and responsible legal system in Zimbabwe. • That enabling a climate where democratic rights are required by a conscious population that demands that constitutional and human rights be upheld and protected. • Increased understanding and awareness of legal issues. • An organization that is financially sustainable, has motivated staff and that works efficiently and effectively.
The total budget for the effort is 2,390,000 USD, Sweden contributes a total of 15,000,000 SEK (1,760,000 USD) during the period 2016-2019, in accordance with the above distribution.

The intervention will strengthen the capacity of Zimbabweans to assert their legal and human rights with confidence and trust in the justice delivery system. The rationale underpinning the work of the LRF is that providing legal knowledge and free legal services for the marginalised vulnerable and strengthening the capacity of service providers in the justice delivery system will create a society more ready to advocate for their democratic rights.
To achieve the LRF seeks to achieve the following results: - Strengthened capacity of Zimbabweans to assert their human and legal rights with confidence and trust in the justice delivery service. - Enhanced access to justice for the vulnerable, observance of the rule of law and expanded constitutional and human rights jurisprudence in Zimbabwe. - An efficient and accountable justice delivery system in Zimbabwe - An enabling environment where democratic rights are claimed by an informed public that demands the protection and enforcement of constitutional and human rights. - Increased understanding and greater awareness of legal issues. - An organisation that is financially sustainable has motivated staff and is able to effectively and efficiently deliver on its mandate

tag.narrative: 16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.

description.narrative: The following is a summary of achieved by LRF to date: 1). The LRF assisted 46,427 people who due to their personal circumstances would not have been able to access justice in the absence of the LRF support. The organization defended, protected and advanced the rights of marginalized and vulnerable groups protecting them from GBV, arbitrary eviction and abuse . 2). In response to the COVID 19 pandemic the organization improved access to justice to over 747 people through its Sida supported toll- free line from the 30th of April to 8 May 2020. In the absence of such toll- free line the organization would have found it difficult to operate during the lockdown period.3). LRF empowered communities through raising awareness on the Declaration of Rights and the law with the result that the empowered individuals and communities asserted their rights and used the law to seek redress or defend their rights. LRF reached out to a total of 149,483 people through its interventions. 25 % of those who sought legal assistance from LRF had been empowered through legal education programmes. 4). In 2020, LRF contributed to protecting victims of SGBV through training of Victim Friendly Unit officers who handle GBV case. A total of 519 were trained with the courts and National Prosecuting Authority attesting to an improvement in the quality of the work that they are delivering following the training. Respect for the rights of prisoners greatly improved as a result of the training which was directed towards prison officers. 5). The rural population accessed justice in traditional courts whose chiefs and headmen had been trained by the LRF and JSC. The JSC confirmed that there was an improvement in the quality of judgments being handed down by traditional courts as a result of the training.6). Trained community volunteers are making a difference in their communities. Their key role was recognised during the COVID pandemic as they provided support to their communities. They have also played key roles in protecting the rights of community members.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
